The owner is almost always on site and is friendly and welcoming.  Also if you happen to get Matt B  as a server tell him Jordan says work harder, and give him a good tip.

I am so happy Brat Haus has stuck around Old Town. Such a wonderful place with good eats, great beer and a phenomenal patio! We actually love it so much we had our engagement party out back in April.  I was fortunate enough to attend an yelp event here some time ago which was my first experience as they were trying to generate some traffic. For a place whose name suggests a very meat centric menu, I was impressed with their vegetarian options. Many events cater to carnivores, and while still fun, it was much more enjoyable to sample a larger variety of the menu. The French fries are delicious and it's totally acceptable if not encouraged to have fries and beer as a complete meal. The pretzels were kind of stale at first taste but I've ordered them since and they were much fresher and softer. The mustard options are plentiful! 6 mustard choices deserves it's own star.  The patio truly is one of my favorites in town. Lovely even in the summer (thanks some kind of futuristic uber fan) and provides plenty of entertainment. Our engagement party guests especially loved playing ping pong and tether ball. Our food included veggie sliders, meat sliders, and the kale salad. The veggie sliders were a little underwhelming as far as texture and flavor goes, but overall the food was great. The service is what really soared above expectations. They handled a group of 40 with so much attention and friendliness. I think I may just have my birthday party here as well!

Why does this place have to be so far away? The brats are amazing. The pretzels are the best I've ever had. And the beer cheese... one day I will learn how make something that tastes as good at home. And then have to start running weekly marathons.  The beer selection is great. There is plenty on tap and the prices are pretty reasonable. Where else can you get a German Oktoberfest on tap in March?  Pretty much everything is made on site. The pretzels, the brats, even the sauerkraut is made here and from local ingredients. If you end up sampling a lot, the price can get high fast but if you just come in for a brat it can be a reasonable lunch.

Love the friendly vibe here!  I believe there are seats indoors, but the outdoor picnic tables are where the party's happening.  Brat Haus has darts, ping pong, and a variety of other outdoor games that you can play while waiting for your food to get done, and they also have a dog-friendly policy which leads to even more mid-meal entertainment.  The restaurant also has daily events, from "dogs eat free" days (they seem to have sausages for the dogs as well!) to movie nights.  The food is also killer, and although I didn't try any drinks while here, they also seem to have an extensive beer list as well.  We had an original pretzel with cheese, a sample of the rattlesnake chili (tastes awesome when used as a dip for the pretzel!), and a sweet brat, which is topped with sweet onions and apple (consider adding the root beer onions for more sweetness!).  Delicious.  This is definitely not your standard "hot dog" place.  We'll be back!

My son and I came here for dinner a few nights ago.  It was our second visit since we moved to the valley.  We chose to be seated outside since the weather was finally cool enough to do so.  This time, I ordered the pretzel appetizer.  It was phenomenal.  Best pretzel on the planet.  My son ordered the spicy brat and garlic fries, and I ordered the burger w/cheese and garlic fries, and we both had beer.    The first time we came here, I ordered the burger because the waitress said they grind their own beef and season it their own way.  I was blown away by the flavor, and was so looking forward to the same experience.  This time I was a little let-down as the flavor was very different.  There were visible seeds in the burger that 'popped' when chewed, and I really didn't like that very much.  (I believe they were mustard seeds.)  The fries were great, except they weren't as garlicky as the first time we were there.    We love the buns at Brat Haus - really the best of any restaurant we've visited.  Service was great, and we didn't feel rushed at all.  Our waiter knew his beers.  And the pretzel is terrific.  I'm sure I'll go back, but just for a pretzel and beer.

Nice place for a family lunch on a beautiful Sunday that we could enjoy the outdoor patio. The food is good not great but good. I had the tri-tip and it was slightly dry and a little chewy. Our server, Nick W was great and had great recommendations. He recommended the pulled pork which my husband had and after trying it I was sorry I hadn't gotten that. The beans were delicious sweet not spicy, and the mac-n-cheese was creamy but could have been cheesier. My mother had the chicken wings, nude and said they were just okay. Her onion rings were good but a little greasier than I would have liked them. They have a good selection of beers. The atmosphere is industrial and very casual.

Used to live in Phoenix, was back in town visiting for a wedding and a friend took us here while out for the night in Scottsdale.  What a great find!  My boyfriend was a HUGE fan of the beers--great selection and so many varieties and sizes to choose from.  The food was incredible!!  We started out with the Fundido--the pretzel was so delicious and dipping it in the beer cheese was the perfect compliment.  My boyfriend had the Haus Brat and tried it with the house-made mustards--simply delicious.  I had the Vegan burger, and I have to say it was one of the best vegan burgers I have ever had for a place that is centered around the Pig and all its forms.  So utterly perfect and delicious and everyone that sampled it at the table agreed the flavors were amazing!  We had a basket of fries to share with the dipping sauces.  So scrumptious.  This place is a must-try and a must-revisit!  We didn't get to sit out on the patio because it was reserved but it looked like a great place to hang out with friends--especially with the great Phoenix weather!    The service was spectacular.  The waiter was super-knowledgeable about all of the beers and offered suggestions when my boyfriend was looking for specific types, etc.  He was also great with being honest about suggestions for food on the menu--I really appreciate the honesty from waiters at restaurants.  He was amazing and our entire experience there was amazing.  We will definitely go back the next time we are in AZ and I will definitely recommend it to friends!!

I really like Brat Haus!! Met a large group for a birthday party on a Friday night and they seemed to be very accommodating. The patio is gorgeous and the theme is awesome. It feels like you are transported to Germany. We ordered two large pretzels as appetizers and let me tell you they are BIG one is definitely large enough for 4-6 people and the pretzel is delicious. I feel like Old Town restaurants all have this secret contest of who has the best pretzels with cheese. Brat Haus is in the running for sure!   The accordion player was wonderful. He played happy birthday for the birthday girl and we all sang. He was just a nice guy and looked like he was having a great time. It was a great touch!  You really cant beat, awesome pretzels, good beer, good brats and an accordion player!

The ambiance is better than the food. An outdoor beer garden with twinkle lights is awesome for spring and fall nights in Scottsdale. For kids there's corn hole, huge blocks for building & sidewalk chalk. A big ol' sign on the side of the wall says, "I wish I had the courage" with several lines below where diners can add their wishes with chalk.  Food was interesting but hit or miss. Fries with beer cheese sauce and bacon were irresistible. My Molotov Cocktail with green chile vodka, raspberry, lime & ginger beer was good...for about 3 sips. The haus brat was super yummy (for America) but the ginger pork and chicken sausage was small, mushy and grainy. The German potato salad was served warm - which must be how they serve it somewhere in Germany but I've been to Germany three times and was always served a more traditional yellow potato salad. This version was just not for me.  We'll be back, though, hopefully for Oktoberfest or some other celebration!

Nice spot for lunch or a casual dinner with friends with its low-key atmosphere.  Service was impeccable when we went, really attentive and helpful when we asked questions about top sellers.  It's easy to over-order, as everything sounds so enticing!  The soft pretzel is warm, toasty, soft and lightly chewy (the right kind of chew you'd want from a good pretzel).  Their sliders are nicely portioned and always juicy and tender.  Their brats are good; not too salty, savory, and flavorful.  My husband is a big fan of the Sean sandwich, which is quite filling!

$12 for a normal draft size Belgian beer.  It's not that much elsewhere in the valley.  Insane.  I feel bad for people who order it without having seen the menu with the prices on it.  Pretzels were fresh, hot, and delicious.  They're not authentic German style ones, by the way, but they are good for what they are.  The grain mustard was a little disappointing because it was so mild.  Fries were delicious.  Glassware is a nice plus.  Parking is even worse than the old Oreganos here because they nixed the interior spots too.  Staff seemed rather ignorant of beers they serve and beer in general, and this place is promoted as a beer destination.  UPDATE: bad service is more common on recent visits, including some attitude from one of the servers for no good reason.  Falafel appetizer was horribly dry and unpleasant on last visit too.    Looking forward to the Union Barrel House opening up next door which is supposed to be a craft beer destination sort of place.

I had been excited to try Brat Haus and it didn't disappoint when my husband and I dropped in last night.  We sat at the bar in the Bru Haus and chatted with the bartender a bit. Their beer selection was amazing: craft brews - most of them on draft but some options in a can as well. They carried some of our favorites: Dogfish Head 90-minute IPA, Bells Two-Hearted, Dale's Pale Ale.  If I remember correctly, prices ranged from $5-8...not terrible and plenty of them were priced at the lower end of the range.They have a very short list of house cocktails (4 or 5) for the non-beer drinkers but I thought they sounded delicious and for a moment I was tempted to order a cocktail instead.  I ordered the Thai Brat with apricot onion chutney. I had been warned that it would be spicy since it contained sriracha but I like some heat so I ordered it anyway. The mix of sweet and spicy was nice, but I will admit that 3/4 of my way through it I had to hand the rest over to my husband -- too spicy. It was almost so spicy that I feared I was missing out on some really good flavors going on in there, but I still enjoyed it. He ordered the Spicy Brat with sauerkraut. The brat was not as spicy as the Thai brat but it was delicious. The bar was lined with ketchup, mustard, curry ketchup, honey mustard, whole grain mustard, and dijon mustard. My husband was happy because he used curry ketchup at home. I like regular ketchup so much that I normally don't use it but it was a nice addition to the Thai Brat.  Fries? A-MAZING! A small order was plenty to split but I could've eaten a large just because it's so hard to stop eating them. You are given a choice of about 8 dipping sauces. We had the bacon bleu-cheese, but all of the options sounded great so it was a tough choice.  We splurged and got dessert. We typically skip this last course, but I had to try the butterscotch root beer float. LOVED IT! Made with vanilla ice cream and Dang's Butterscotch Root Beer, very clever.   The service was great, the food was outstanding. There is something for everyone here. Can't wait to go back!

So I personally am not a huge fan of the German foods, unlike my wife that loves this stuff. It was date night and I compromise sometimes so we took a visit to this restaurant that was new to both of us. Walking in it was lively, there was a couple guys jamming out on the accordion and don't know what the other thing was but it sounded good. They sat us quickly at this huge long table and honestly it wasn't as intimate as I thought it would be. There was like 4 feet of space inbetween us. We made the best of it though, you just kinda gotta holler at each other. My wife got the schnitzel and I got a spicy brat and she liked the schnitzel and my brat was pretty good but plain (maybe this is expected from german food?). The service was horrible though. We were checked on maybe 2 times in the whole 1.5 hrs we were there. Our water was mostly empty and my wifes beer never got offered to get refilled. As we left the host was playing on her phone not really paying attention to the 2 people standing behind her trying to get a table. She was nice enough to take a second from texting to wish us a good night. Based on service I wouldn't return, if my wife wanted to go back id sit thru it again.... The things we do for our wives.....

I have been here multiple times and I really enjoy the food! I will not give it five stars because the service is not always very good. one waiter that works there and has attended to myself and whoever I am with is rude and very sassy. I read through the reviews and I think that it is the same waiter that everyone points out for bad service. Other than getting him as a server it is a good place to eat and the atmosphere is great.

what started out really poorly was saved by an excellent manager. we arrived at brat haus around 5 for an early father's day dinner. we were seated, given menus and waters and then promptly ignored for 20 minutes.   we tried to get the attention of a nearby waitress, but she wouldn't turn in our direction. finally, another person in our party went to the hostess stand and asked if we could be waited on. they sent over the girl who had given us our menus and she mumbled nary an apology over a "server mix up". even if that were true, there were only 2 other tables near us and at least 2 other waitress assigned to our area. why are you not casually glancing around the room to make sure everyone is taken care of, even if it's not "your" table?   anyway, we ordered and were prepared to dislike everything on principle, but the manager who brought over our beers, told us round 1 was on the house due to their mistake and then later sent over a delicious and piping hot pretzel and cheese appetizer for us to try. kudos to them for quickly rectifying the situation.  we each tried a different brat (spicy, sweet, veal and wild boar) and a few different toppings (pickled onions, sauerkraut and a sweet chutney). everyone was very pleased with their selections, i think we just wish the bread was a little more traditional. the various mustards and ketchups that came to the table were great, as were the garlic fries.  all in all, what began disappointingly, ended really well and we will definitely come back again in the future--especially to check out the outside seating when the weather cools down.

This was another lunch trip on my on hour of freedom away from work and a very well spent one.  When we got there it wasn't empty so that's a good sign. We saw the seat yourself sign and found a nice table. It looks like they've got a good amount of room for bigger crowds. Although I'm not 100% sure it looked all outside. This wasn't an issue for us because AZ is great for year round outdoor seating, but this is something to consider on days that you may not want to be outside.  We heard about the very tempting beer selections from our waiter, but decided to skip it since there was the inevitable return to work.   We got the fresh pretzels and beer cheese app to start and two brats. It was all delicious and we left full. The only thing I could have wanted more was fresh pretzel rolls for the brats.   The servers were all nice & knowledgeable, the prices were good for what we got and the food was fast. The latter being crucial for actually fitting outings into a work lunch time frame.   Conclusion: We'll definitely be back. Hopefully for happy hour so I can pair up some beer with the brats and get some good deals.

I hate to do this but I must. We stopped into Brat Haus yesterday on a gorgeous sunny afternoon. Our party of 12 arrived in two sets of 6 diners. We opted for outdoor seating after being greeted in the most reticent of ways. Before I go further, it was NOT crowded! Our server was the most inattentive, unfriendly, and downright surly waitress I have ever encountered. Her defiant disgust was evident from start to finish. We waited 20 minutes for water, another 15 - 20 for our drink orders to be taken. We did split checks, and I know this is not easy for servers or welcome actually, but the rude dismissal is so unnecessary. I can't imagine we're the first group to ask to split the check here. I also understand that 18% was placed immediately on our tabs for service, and she never would have received that tip from me. However, good service would have earned so much more for the effort. Maybe a smile once?? Waters were never refilled, the food was merely passable today, and not one among us thought our service was anything but bad. Two stars today for the beer selection, and nothing else. I know this review won't detract from your popularity, but hey... In the absence of good service, I won't be back to spend my money here when there are so many other choices around town. Oh, and the single ladies' bathroom out back was dirty too. Sorry.

I've been wanting to try Brat Haus forever, but with so many choices in old town, I hadn't gotten here until today. Well... Now I can say... been there; done that; never again. I met my brother there for a late lunch--it was mediocre at best. Tables in the bar area were sticky dirty and ones in other building not set for service. We sat in the bar building and just avoided putting elbows on table. Lol. (The menus were also filthy with dried mustard and other debris.) We should have left then and gone somewhere that values its customers more. But, undeterred yet, we persevered. To start, we shared a pretzel. It was okay--large but nothing special. There are lots of mustard choices on the table, but most of the house made ones had a weird aftertaste to them. Next, I had the sausage board and my brother ordered a beef dog, as he doesn't generally eat pork. The server brought him sausage by mistake. She was very apologetic and offered to replace with a hot dog, but my brother kept it when he confirmed they would have to throw the sausage out. (He doesn't like to see animal products wasted.) The sausage board was good--each served atop a relish/picked veg. We also shared an order of fries. They were decent but, again, nothing special. Although the server was pleasant, service was pretty awful considering how tiny the place is. At one point, I spilled half my soda. The mess of soaking wet napkins and ice sat in the middle of our table for about 15 min before we could get the bartenders attention to take it away. She never brought fresh napkins, despite asking three times, until my brother went to the counter to get them. (Beware, if you need extra, the replacements are bathroom paper towels.) Finally, we didn't ask for a comp, and my brother did eat the sausage, but it certainly would have been good business to acknowledge the screwup even a bit on the bill, but of course not. All in all, a disappointing experience. Really not sure what the hype is. There are so many fabulous restaurant choices in town, I'd advise picking somewhere else.
Great food. You have to get the pig Mac. The waiter you have to ask for is Mike he was personable and refreshing person to talk to. A little pricey over $50.00 for to Pig mac's, large fries 4 beers

Great concept poor execution. Bread was stale service included some attitude when we said no to outside that was 110.  Also was restrictive when we asked for more paper towels..... really if u guys want to cost cut or restrict patrons from how many towels they use..... time to close.....
Legit one of the best pretzels I've ever had in my life also has a really cool atmosphere and patio
Plethora of brats. Cheese curds were the best ive had outside of Wisconsin. There #1 beer is terrific.

From the other yelp reviews some of the burgers sounded to good to pass up.  We shared the Pig Mac Burger which has a sausage patty with a burger patty along with many condiments.  I also had them include a fried egg along with the house specialty hush hush sauce. The burger sounded better than what it actually tasted.   We also got the Brat Burger and an order of garlic fries. The garlic fries were very good and probably the best thing we ordered.   We sat outside on a nice Sunday afternoon and was great with a huge patio area.  As for the hush hush sauce it is a variation of thousand island.   We did not have their specialty items - pretzels,  beer or brats.   Overall I liked the idea but seemed like it was a bit missing.

I was here recently for an event. We had the beer and pretzels. I did not have dinner.   The back patio was so awesome here. The owner was out there for our event and was very friendly. The pretzels were so awesome and the sauce, that I'd go back for them.   I got the San Tan Count Hopula  (sp?) which I loved but when I asked for a second one, it was NOT the same beer. I was very disappointed. I sent it back.  She brought another back and swore it was the Count Hopula but I know that beer. It wasn't. She was adamant. I was disappointed. Pretzels and ambience is 4 stars, waitress and bad beer not so much.

This is a long overdue review.  I must have been having a terrible day when I wrote my review back in 2013.  I'm so glad that Monica suggested Brat Haus for our October 2016 International Supper Club UYE meetup.  I was reminded that I had never returned since I gave them a bratty review.   Well, I enjoyed my meal and the service so much for the October ISCUYE meetup that I went back for lunch yesterday too.  The outside space for this restaurant is simply divine.  Lots of picnic style tables and plenty of shade.  Hands-down, their fried pickles are A-1!  I don't understand how they get the some crispy.  Their Dutch fries are wonderful too.  I'm still figuring out the sausage thing.  While  I love sausage, I was not a fan of the house spicy sausage.  I did enjoy the chorizo sausage.    BTW, they are expanding the business into the building next door (north side) with an extended restaurant called "Smoke Haus".  Is that supposed to be German BBQ?  I wonder.  Well, good news is, they have a large parking lot behind that building, so parking should be fairly easy.    I'm going back again, maybe not until the spring, but I'll be back... I still have to have a sausage and beer.  :-)  And I havn't made it to the poutine yet.  But that's on my to-try-list too.  Return Factor 80%

Such a cool and unique outdoor patio! My favorite beer is the Goulden Carolus Cuv√®e van de Keizer Imperial Dark. (That was a handful to pronounce) It's 75 years old but I'll let you google that... My server was the most adorable redhead Angelina! Great service and keep up the good work! Will be back with friends and family for sure!!!
This is probably the worst sausage I ever had. Ordered hot Italian and it was tasteless and had a huge dry bun.For $10 it was a rip-off.Skip it if you're smart.
